bibl.title: Mummies for Export? The Repatriation of a Corpse from Alexandria to Ancyra in the Roman Imperial Period. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: An inscription on a sarcophagus of the mid- or late second century AD found at Ancyra (modern Ankara, Turkey) indicates that it contained the repatriated body of an Ancyran who died in Alexandria. It seems likely that his body had been mummified to allow for his return.
bibl.seg: BENNETT Julian, Mummies for Export? The Repatriation of a Corpse from Alexandria to Ancyra in the Roman Imperial Period. Avec résumé en anglais.

An inscription on a sarcophagus of the mid- or late second century AD found at Ancyra (modern Ankara, Turkey) indicates that it contained the repatriated body of an Ancyran who died in Alexandria. It seems likely that his body had been mummified to allow for his return.
